Reviews.Title: Bottom line:  Reasonably priced Canon camera, but not perfect
Reviews.Author: Yarii
Reviews.Content: I decided on the Canon A495 as I wanted an inexpensive camera to carry around in my bag for unexpected shots. For those of you who want a good basic camera from a well-known camera company, this one should fit your needs well.Are you trying to decide between the A495 and the next model lower, the A490?  Here are the differences:· The A495 has a Face Self-Timer feature.  You can focus on a group of people, and before the camera takes the shot, run over and get into the picture yourself, with your face being detected, too.  Of course, you would also need a tripod or a place to set the camera down.· The A495 has two (2) additional Scene Modes:  Poster Effect and Super Vivid Color.  Nice to have the additional scenes, but how often will you use them?  I plan on making some art for my living room walls with the Poster Effect scene, so I opted for the A495.· The A495 will focus on up to 9 faces (or areas); whereas the A490 will focus on up to 5 faces (or areas).I would have given this camera 5 stars if it wasn't so darn slow on the recycling time after taking a photo.  It flashes "busy" on the LCD screen and it is frustrating when you are waiting to take another shot.NOTE #1:  This camera does not come with an SD card, so pick one up when buying the camera as you will not be able to use it right out of the box otherwise.  This camera will accept SDHC cards up to/including 32 GB.NOTE #2:  The PSC-500 genuine Canon case Canon PSC-500 Deluxe Soft Case fits this camera perfectly, but there is no extra room for spare batteries.  It's a snug fit, but it's well padded too.NOTE #3: For those of you looking for a camera that can put a date stamp on your pictures, this one does. You have your choice of date only or date and time - or none at all.

Reviews.Title: A good value, that takes great pictures
Reviews.Author: CAMPJEEP
Reviews.Content: Simple, easy to use, feels good in the hands and it does take great pictures. A great choice for a first digital camera.It's the perfect camera to have if you're on a budget but want to capture great quality pictures.  A 2.5 sec delay between shots with out the flash, ( with the flash on the avg is around. 3 TO 6 secs ),  and start up time is 1.6  sec. *The camera does not have optical image stabilization.*No memory card included with this camera*. I use a 2gig san disk sd card ultra II(you do not get one with the camera)  that gives you about 750 pictures. I use 2 AA energizer (lithium batterys)(or 2650-2900 mAH rechargables) and that gets about 500-550 pictures .  You would not be happy with just standerd AA battery life.Walmarts, Meijers stores have a 8 pack of AA energizer lithium batterys for about $16.80,they seem to last for ever. I just use these like for vacation or a hloidays, for just every day shooting I use (good) rechargeables. The AA batterys are probably the reason the LCD screen  takes so long to recharge after the flash goes off (and to take the next picture) even with the good batterys it is recharging the flash up to 8sec on a (full flash) recharge and the times that are stated above...I set the disp overlay to grid lines to help take a straighter picture, You may use it for the 1/3 rule also).Cons:  None for this price point.No camera is perfect  Some are having trouble with the shutter button trying to push it half way down trying to compose there picture, on this camera, you only have to touch the shutter button and the weight of your finger will do the trick, if you try to push it half way like the canon A480 or your old camera it will take the picture...  (Update)>  It seems to free up the more you use it but still not like the cameras before it... Other Thoughts:* The A495 takes great pictures but you will not be able to tell it by the low resolution lcd screen, you will have to wait and look at them on the computer to realy see how good they are. It is sometimes hard to compose your shot in very bright sun light also.* I just realy like the colors in the pictures that the canon cameras produce, again thats just me thinking out loud. I know this all sounds bad but for the price this camera does take great pictures and is easy and fun to use.It is on par for this price point.I have bought these for my 4 and 6 year old grand kids ( The canon A 480s) and have had no trouble for a year now.The next step up is a canon SD 1300 that I know anything about  and you can get a upgrade on this stuff if you just can't live with the A495 (I have never used a A3100)so I can not speak for it. I am no expert and I am trying to be honest here and help out if I can, these are just my thoughts, look at some of the pictures that I and others have posted on this site if that would be helpfull and  check out the other reviews on the A495 and good luck on your next camera. I have these cameras (SD 1300,A480 A 495) I really like them.I mostly take pictures of bear in the Smokey Mountians (CADES COVE) and love chaseing the grand kids around taking their pictures. ( And this year I fell in love with the Outter Banks in NC ).

Reviews.Title: the little camera that could!
Reviews.Author: rob damage "musician, hard-core gamer, old-sc...
Reviews.Content: i've had many digital point & shoots in the past and i've got to say that the A495 is simply the best. here you have a camera you can take pictures with with ease in automatic mode and then further your picture taking skills with both the program mode and the settings mode. for anyone with experience in digital cameras, the aforementioned settings are familiar territory- but one should know, never has navigating the settings been easier and faster. not only is this a handy little camera to have around for those 'just in case' moments, but it is a great camera to grow with. i really wish that this was my very first introduction to the digital camera world! put in a little effort and viola! in no time, you're taking pictures worth framing. at 10 mega pixels, these shots can be blown up to poster size, suitable for hanging!!the camera also comes with a video mode- great for shooting small video clips, an AV cable- to attach to your TV set to watch your pics & videos on the big screen, a USB cable- to upload your pics/vids to your computer for editing, and a disk with a pdf instruction manual, and the solid Canon Zoom browser for editing your pics.in all, a perfect pocket sized camera not only for the person that doesn't feel like lugging around something bigger & more expensive, but for someone on a tight budget that wants something with quality and the ability to learn with.(honorable mention has to go to the 'posterize' camera setting. i included some of the pics i took in this mode- i'm absolutely addicted to shooting with this setting in widescreen!!!)finally, nothing is without flaws: if i absolutely HAD to find fault with this camera this would be it:1. AA battery life (definitely bring backup batteries- or better yet, rechargables)2. (another person mentioned in another review) flash recovery takes a few seconds- that could mean the difference between a decent pic and a blurry mess. although it goes without saying that this is a problem in almost ALL compact digital cameras.3. no view finder (i'm reaching here- this has never been a concern of mine, yet some people absolutely NEED one).

Reviews.Title: picture going out of focus
Reviews.Author: slg
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera from reviews and the good price.  This particular camera would go out of focus when the button to take the picture was pushed.  I had someone else who was camera aware check it out and they experienced the same problem.  I have returned the camera and hope to find a better choice.

Reviews.Title: blurry pictures
Reviews.Author: Kristian E. Johnson
Reviews.Content: We have always liked canon powershots...  but this one is not on par with the other models we've used.We're returning it to get a more expensive model, but one that takes quality pictures.if the lighting isn't perfect, or if there is movement, the pictures come out blurry.

Reviews.Title: Great image quality for price...
Reviews.Author: mack77
Reviews.Content: I  bought this camera today!  I wanted a small camera that is easy to carry around.  It has the same lens as the Canon A480 & a well known British camera magazine gave that camera a rating of 93%, mainly because of its excellent image quality.  And because I used to have a Canon A1000IS.They gave the A495 a rating of 86%, presumably because other brands had kinda caught up to Canon's level of performance and features.I would definitely recommend buying rechargeable Nimh batteries because the starter alkaline batteries only did 54 shots, 1 10 second video, & quite a lot of reviewing, looking at the menus etc,before the low battery warning popped up.  (It was a very cold day though around 10 degrees celsius.)I've only used the camera on full auto so far & the photos look beautiful to me.  At low iso settings they look just as good as many more expensive cameras I've owned.  (Before buying the A495 I had a Fuji S200 EXR which took superb photos but was too big & heavy for me.)Other comments:The battery & SD card compartment has a nicely designed plastic latch.  Sturdier than Canon A1000IS.Nicer to hold than Canon A3000ISLCD screen works quite well even in bright sun.  Looks far better than one budget Kodak model I looked at.Update:  Maybe I got an extra good lens, but the photos this little camera takes in full auto mode are amazing.  Slow shot to shot times but fine forlandscapes & people pix if they pose for you.  I have bought Energizerrechargeable batteries 2450 mAh & one charge has lasted me several days ofpicture taking and transferring to PC with USB cable.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: Nsomniac
Reviews.Content: Some features of this camera are merely inconvenient, like the very short battery life and the wait of several seconds between flash photos.  But the deal breaker is the blurry pictures that result from focus issues.  I tried for several weeks to adjust to the camera, but it's practically unusable with that issue.I'm a Canon fan, and bought this camera to replace my venerable SD400 after seeing a good review in Consumer Reports.  Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: Would have loved it, but battery life is AWFUL.
Reviews.Author: M. Brownlie "bluembrownlee"
Reviews.Content: Sorry to say, this is my 1st negative review of a product on Amazon and I hate to do it, however I would not be able to recommend this camera model to anyone!  (I have had Canon Powershots in the past that I loved, too.)I bought this camera and immediately fell in love.  It was easy to use, took great macro and regular shots, and was just an overall wonderful camera!  That was until the batteries started going out after about taking 50 shots with it.  No flash was being used at all, it was only in macro mode.  And this happened repeatedly no matter what batteries I used.  I have at least 4 different sets of rechargeable AA's that I have used successfully with my other camera.  They would last forever in that one, but not in this camera!  You get about 50 shots and that's it.  Basically this makes this camera completely USELESS for me.  I have an online business that requires me to take many shots to weed out the best ones to use - and needless to say after going through 4 different sets of batteries within 15 minutes time after time has made me furious.  I am going to return this camera today, garbage!!

Reviews.Title: Lemon?
Reviews.Author: BookReviewer "hklibros"
Reviews.Content: This camera takes two AA batteries, which last about 24 hours.  I'm not sure if I got a lemon or what but the battery life makes this camera just about unusable.  Picture quality is fine - if the camera will take the picture.  Most of the time, I take out the camera and it won't work because the battery has died.  Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value for the price
Reviews.Author: Joe Godwin
Reviews.Content: Despite the somewhat tepid reviews of this product on Amazon, I found it to be completely adequate for my picture taking purposes and I've encountered no problems in the use thereof.  I believe it to be an excellent value for the price.

Reviews.Title: OK camera for a child or beginner
Reviews.Author: J. Greer
Reviews.Content: If you find a good deal on this, it might be worth it for the non-serious photographer in your life. The camera is small, sturdy and pretty easy to use. I bought it for my daughter to use, but honestly, she says the pictures are just as good from her iPod, so she uses that more. The battery life is terrible, even with rechargable batteries. You can get about two hours' heavy use with this and you do have to change batteries. It's not up to the Canon quality that I expected, but it was inexpensive and it works fine for fun use by a teenager.

Reviews.Title: solid camera
Reviews.Author: chris l. "thumizee"
Reviews.Content: this camera is very easy to use and the pictures come out great! it isn't heavy which makes it less fragile and easy to carry and although it doesn't have the look of an extremely high tech camera, the functions and resolution are greatly satisfying. of course, it isn't the best digital camera in the world and the battery life is not the most economic but, overall i am really content with this product and i would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Oh, BOY!!!!
Reviews.Author: E. HESSE
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my parents 45 year anniversary.  They absolutely love it except for the battery life.  OMG, since getting them their new camera, I can't even tell you how many batteries I have had to buy for it!!!  It it wasn't for the battery life, this camera takes absolutely beautiful PICS.  Hate the battery use however, love the pics...60/40

Reviews.Title: Daily User
Reviews.Author: Mrs. B
Reviews.Content: It is great as a daily camera. I use it for documenting reports. The macro is more convenient than a field copy machine for copying documents on low or high quality. Shoot, save, transfer to my lap top and I am good to go. It is small and easy to handle. My only complaint is that even with fresh batteries in the cold it seem to take a long time to recharge the flash even when there is no need for the flash. It needs to complete charging or it will not take the next picture. I have had 35mm Nikon cameras for years and had good service. I have had two Nikon Coolpixs, The last Coolpix lasted about a week. The manager of the local dealer at Wolf Camera (at Fox Valley Centre, in Aurora, Illinois), a national camera chain told me I did not know how to use the camera and they needed to send it to their service centre and in 6 to 8 weeks would let me know if they would exchange out the camera, if they decided it was not my fault. In the mean time I could purchase another camera. Since the previous camera lasted only about 6 months I decided to try a different make and maybe even consider a cheaper type of camera. My previous Cannon model died after being used for well over a year in rain, dirt, snow, and being dropped. It finally died from my falling on it while it was open and it still works just very noisy. I could not trust it not to die in the middle of a field inspection. I'm glad I got this one it is even better quality than the older model and cheaper. The old noisy one is now my backup. The other thing High on my requirements is generic batteries and memory, AA batteries and SD memory. I can not allow a priority accessories. I need to be able to pick-up accessories in the field in an emergency. PS: I told the camera store to keep the Nikon and I will not be back to pick it up. My new camera store is called Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Pretty happy
Reviews.Author: April M
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for the specifically because I wanted something small and easy to bring around.  I have a Canon DSLR and so I wasn't looking for something that takes amazing photos or anything.  However, it's pretty inconvenient to carry around all the time. This camera is perfect for stuffing in your bag to be ready to take quick photos so you don't miss documenting anything.  The quality of the photos is actually really very good especially for the price.It does have a few cons.  It's pretty slow between taking photos and the battery life is pretty short with regular AA batteries.Other than that, it's easy to use, light, cute and handy.  It's awesome for the price!

Reviews.Title: So pleased.
Reviews.Author: B. Etter "Jim"
Reviews.Content: Instead of buying the newer, much more expensive Canon Powershot, I went with this one.  And I'm so happy with it.  Takes great pictures, is small, and didn't cost me all that much.  Yay!

Reviews.Title: Camera stopped working less than 60 days
Reviews.Author: Paul Mroz
Reviews.Content: This camera worked great for 35 days.  Now it only turns on and wont take pictures.  Do not buy this camera.  I wish I could get a refund.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot A495
Reviews.Author: Bernice H. Olson
Reviews.Content: I absolutely hate this camera. I had the previous version and loved it but my grand daughter accidently dropped it in the bathtub. This camera uses up the batteries like crazy. I have rechargables and they die sooner than non rechargables. Just when you want to take the best picture you get the message that your flash is recharging and by then the shot you wanted to take is gone. the pictures are blurry and disoriented. I wish I had never gotten this camera. Bad Purchase.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera (you get what you pay for)
Reviews.Author: Sumit K. Maitra
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera knowing about it's battery limitations. But it takes AAs Come on now!!!Over the years I've grown used to the fact, point and shoots don't take good low light pictures, so I wasn't expecting a lot.Very happy with the results. So price to performance ratio is unbeatable. If you have to take low light pictures, use a tripod and some noise removal software.Coming back to the battery life. The reason why it gives poor battery life is this thing is not programmed to 'pause' focusing when not required. So as long as you have the lens open it keeps trying to focus onto something or the other. You will constantly hear the servo spinning and lens clicking as it tries to focus on what it 'thinks' you are looking at (even if you are not looking through the view finder). Once you realize this the fix is easy. After you have taken your pictures, put it in playback/preview mode. Then it knows for sure it need not try and focus and stops wasting battery.Overall 4 star for the value quotient. 3 stars for picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Excellent First Camera
Reviews.Author: Rob
Reviews.Content: This is my first digital camera. I settled on it after reading the full Editor's Review at cnet.com. They liked the quality of it's photographs better than some more expensive cameras. It's a budget camera that takes sharp photos.This camera has very good macro capabilities, with or without flash. I find it useful to photograph things before taking them apart so I can, of course, reassemble them.I recommend ditching the AA alkaline batteries and getting Sanyo Eneloop rechargeables. They are one of the few brands that hold up to 80% of their charge during a year in storage. They power the camera much longer than alkalines do and out perform other rechargeable brands.On the down side, the camera's screen washes out in bright sunlight and makes it difficult at times to see what's in the viewfinder. It's also a bit bulky to fit in a pocket, but I probably wouldn't do that since I would be afraid of damaging it somehow. The wrist lanyard isn't adjustable, and I'm sometimes concerned it will slip off my wrist. I bought the optional Canon soft case. That's nice but doesn't have it's own lanyard or a spare battery pouch.All in all I really enjoy using this camera. It's one of my favorite things.

Reviews.Title: Solid camera
Reviews.Author: Kevin French
Reviews.Content: Bought this for our daughter when she turned 7. She dropped it twice the first night and the camera still works fine. The camera is slow to take pictures (before and after the drops), but the resolution is adequate. It is just what I wanted as we tried a "kid friendly" camera before and the resolution was beyond terrible. She did go through an entire set of batteries in one evening.This is really more than I expected from a camera at this price point.

Reviews.Title: Best for the money.
Reviews.Author: J. Carney "Mongoose"
Reviews.Content: If you bought this expecting it to perform like a Canon Mark III then you need to learn more about cameras. For the money it's a great camera. Very basic but still takes great pics. Impressive macro mode. Auto focus performs well. Lots of different options to play with. Very small and fits in a back pocket. I keep mine under my motorcycle seat. This is one of the lower priced canon's so don't expect it to perform like a $6000 camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Value
Reviews.Author: R. Raiz
Reviews.Content: This is my first new digital camera, and I could not be more pleased.  Canon has a reputation of building the best point and shoot cameras, and it is easy to see why.  I was able to use it right out of the box, without reading the manual.  Controls are intuitive.About the only thing I would recommend against is to use the vivid color scene option.  The pictures are oversatuated in color.  However by using the auto setting it takes perfect pictures, and even seems to compensate for any camera movement.I would recommend this as a great starter camera.  Five stars to Canon.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot A495 10.1 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: sandiet
Reviews.Content: I have owned this camera for a few years now. It's a great compact camera and takes good photos for the money.  The only thing is the focus needs adjusting after awhile and the shutter speed could be faster. The battery life is good and the charge unit that comes with it is very nice. I take this camera with me every where and I have used it for big events. If you have the right settings you almost can't tell the same photo taken with this camera and a much more expensive model with lots of features.

Reviews.Title: GREAT BUY
Reviews.Author: Wolfgang922
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera just before my wedding and vacation to Las Vegas. Easy to use, very good quality pictures, simple to download photos on to my computer.

Reviews.Title: Comparing A495 picture quality with my four years old Fuji F20
Reviews.Author: Fountain Pens R Us
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a low cost compact camera within the same price range as my 4 years old Fuji F20 ($90).  I have had some three DSLRs (by the way two of them are made by Canon) and many more point and shoot cameras.  I expected to buy a camera that can provide a better picture quality and be within a similar price range as my 4-5 years old budget camera. After reading quite a few good reviews on various sites, I decided to purchase a Canon A495. Interestingly according to various reviews (as far as the picture quality is concerned), Canon A495 is supposed to outperform even cameras costing twice as much! What I can say is that the picture quality of Canon A495 does not measure up to my old Fuji F20.  I tested both cameras side by side under various lighting conditions (both indoors and outdoors) and at different zoom settings (as picture quality changes also according to zoom setting).  In all the cases, Fuji F20 outperformed Canon A495. In low lighting conditions, pictures taken by A495 were infested by chromatic noise (F20 is known for its low light capability and it did provide much cleaner pictures). However, even in perfect lighting conditions, Fuji F20 resolved details better than Canon A495 and its picture sharpness varied to a lesser extent from the image center to corners.  By the way, Fuji F20 has a 6 megapixel sensor.It is very possible that A495 is better than other higher megapixel mediocre budget point and shoot cameras around today (and perhaps that is why its ratings are good).  However in my opinion performance/price ratio should increase with time not decrease!

Reviews.Title: Good For the Price
Reviews.Author: Cool in Colorado
Reviews.Content: I think this is a nice camera for the price.  I wish it was a little better for taking pictures with movement but for other pictures it does a nice job.  I do believe the next camera I purchase will have better zoom for sports but this one does an ok job with that as well.  I was wanting a camera I could carry in my purse and this one is good for that although it is a little thicker than some.  I would recommend this camera for general picture taking as those pics turn out great.  All in all a good purchase.

Reviews.Title: What a great camera!
Reviews.Author: midegim
Reviews.Content: This camera gives excellent results in the hands of a novice. Purchased for my parents, it is easy to use and easy to get around in. 99% of all users do not need a camera with greater resolution. Buy a camera with good glass used in the lens.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera, great price = 5 stars
Reviews.Author: Ordinary guy
Reviews.Content: This is the 5th A series Canon I have purchased (three for myself, two for my adult daughter). All prior Canons were replaced because they lasted so long they became outdated.  This one was bought because it's very pocketable, uses easily obtained AA cell batteries and mostly because of the price.  The Canon A590IS it supplements is 4 yrs. old, still works great but is a little bulky to fit in my wife's pocketbook.The camera couldn't be easier to use and the stills are very good. Videos are limited to 640x480 but are acceptable from essentially a point and shoot camera.Complaints about battery life must be coming from people using alkaline batteries.  If you buy this, or any other modern AA powered camera, invest in rechargable ni-mh batteries or single use lithium cells.  Alkalines just weren't designed to power large displays and all the other features of modern P&S; cameras.You do have to supply your own memory card but that's consistant throughout newer camera manufactuers.

Reviews.Title: a bargain
Reviews.Author: S. Iverson
Reviews.Content: I took this camera out to the desert and submitted it to a week of very dusty, harsh conditions. I bought the camera because a) it was pretty cheap and well reviewed b)it uses AA batteries so I wouldn't need to charge in the wild c) the size was acceptableWith a good set of rechargeables the camera easily met the factory claims for pictures. The start-up is a bit long, but that was fine. Video does produce a reasonable quality product, but the compression algo. must be only so so because file sizes were quite large.  In daylight, the pictures were very good and night snaps with the flash were OK with expected levels of noise. The same can be said for snaps without flash in low light.My only major issue was that once it got to be dusk the thing had a pretty hard time focusing, even with the assist and a target that was clearly being illuminated. The same can be said for situations where there was a clear target to be acquired (think dark with a spotlight on something) and it often wouldn't find the thing or only after several attempts. This was annoying but in the context of an 80 dollar camera my disappointment is tempered. All-in-all this thing was a trooper and saved my good, expensive cameras a lot of abuse. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: Good buy for the money
Reviews.Author: Eric Dunsker
Reviews.Content: This purchase replaced a similar camera that was stolen.  I've always been happy with the picture quality and ease of use of this camera for the cost (and in this one cost significantly less than the one I lost).  It's slow between pictures (though you can speed things up by eliminating the display of a review function.  It also is not great in low light level, but for the price it's a great buy.BTW: When clarity matters I found it useful to bring a monopod (tripod with one leg).  It's easy to carry and does a lot to steady the camera.

Reviews.Title: Have LOTS and LOTS of batteries handy
Reviews.Author: Protusmike
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is good, nice features, but battery life really sucks on this camera.  Not using any flash I get about 20 pictures before battery change alarm comes on.  Using flash I get about 8 to 10 pictures. If I knew this I'd have got a different camera with similar features.

Reviews.Title: Great web photos
Reviews.Author: Laura L
Reviews.Content: Bought this to take photos for the web, and it does a great job.  Didn't take me long at all to get my first photo up, and I knew nothing going in.  And the photo quality is great for the price.

Reviews.Title: A STEAL OF A DEAL
Reviews.Author: Stasia Shaver "MsSage4U"
Reviews.Content: Exceptionally priced quality camera. It's a CANON for pete's sake... Camera appears well made. Ease of use is very good. My son loves it, and he likes to keep it simple. Finally, something to perhaps keep in mind, Canon cameras are among the very few cameras now being made that can actually still be repaired if necessary. Parts are actually made readily available for repair/replacement, not so with most other cameras now being made. Even the high end/ more expensive cameras made by several well known and regarded companies seem to be assumed to be disposeable after their presumed or planned obsolesence. just consult your local camera repairman, if you can find one...

Reviews.Title: Good camera value
Reviews.Author: Compression
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my sister in law so I don't have first hand knowledge of it but she loves it.  The pictures I've seen are great.

Reviews.Title: Great camera at a great price.
Reviews.Author: Mark Jurentkuff
Reviews.Content: I had been looking for an inexpensive but good quality camera for a long time.  When I saw this one I couldn't pass it up.  So far, I have not been disappointed.  The camera is compact, easy to use and takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Mechanical Failure
Reviews.Author: Fred R. Guevara "ARGuevara"
Reviews.Content: Despite warnings from other reviewers regarding short battery life, I purchased this high-quality little camera and let my granddaughter use it on a day's outing. She took a lot of pictures, many many with flash, and the battery lasted all day. I have since used it on a quick trip to from Ohio to California and back. During all this time I have replaced the batteries once, which I think is reasonable for this type of camera. The resolution, screen brightness, telephoto capability and overall size and convenience rate 5 stars from me!Revision: After a couple of months, the battery cover will not lock.  I am using the camera with duct tape holding it together.  Too late for Amazon return, so here I go trying to get satisfaction from Canon.  Wish me luck!!

Reviews.Title: What a great deal!
Reviews.Author: ArtisticAMD
Reviews.Content: I am not one for updating with new tech so this is my first new camera in 5ish years. I am thrilled with this camera's speed and quality, especially for the price!

Reviews.Title: Love it, love it, love it !!
Reviews.Author: mtay20
Reviews.Content: Last year's CU favorite, and I can see why.  Nice big display.  Pix especially sharp in macro mode.  Bats last long enough for a good shoot.  You run out of juice, you replace with spare rechargables.  What's the problem?  I thought I would have withdrawal pains when my old digital croaked, but the minute I started using this one, I have never looked back.  Excellent value at $69.  I am thinking of buying another just in case I lose this one.

Reviews.Title: Great pics, body cheesy
Reviews.Author: R Harville
Reviews.Content: The battery cover broke within a few weeks of owning it.  Works good still, but have to tape on cover.

Reviews.Title: Decent camera for just $70
Reviews.Author: D. Koons
Reviews.Content: I needed a "throw-away" camera as I did not want to take my digital SLR with me to college. I am biased about Canon, but they make very durable and versatile cameras from my experience. This little guy is cheap, but does produce decent pictures. Be sure to get rechargeable NIMH batteries because this does eat the alkalines and lithium disposables are too expensive. It includes some adequate editing software but you can always download gimp, a free watered-down Photoshop editing software. Would make a nice gift, but remember to purchase an SD card with it. With digital cameras at this price-point, I do not understand why some people still use the fun-savers any more. Images from this are the same if not better than 35mm, even at full page letter photos.

Reviews.Title: Great for the Beginner
Reviews.Author: Demo Woman
Reviews.Content: I am complete novice, so for me this camera is perfect.  I need a camera for my work.  Perfect for the beginner.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for Grandma
Reviews.Author: thatpharmguy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I purchased this camera for my mother-in-law because she needed a camera to take photos of the grand kids. This camera doesn't have a lot of features, which is one reason it is so great for grandma. It starts up fairly fast and take great photos in auto mode. This isn't a professional camera, so you can't expect professional results, but just like most Canon cameras it blows its competition out of the water. If all you need is a simple point and shoot camera that takes great photos - there's no need to hesitate with this superb Canon.

Reviews.Title: Good Value
Reviews.Author: Rose Mora "Redflower"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this particular model because it was recommended by Consumer Reports in their product review. I also wanted a slim style camera that was easy to use and to take on trips. It takes good pictures and is very compact. I consider it a very good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great gift!
Reviews.Author: Sarah Gil
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a present for a family member. I needed it to arrive on time and be ready to use. The recipient was very pleased and excited with her new camera when it showed up before her birthday.

Reviews.Title: Great so far...but only for a couple of months
Reviews.Author: mythology101
Reviews.Content: Bought this on a lightning deal not too long ago and so far I like it. I need accurate color and close up detail for posting photos in ebay. I show a photo at the top of this page of a watch face to show how a close up looks which I'm impressed. Didn't have to set in macro mode, and just 2 inches away the camera took a great photo.November update: Changing the stars to two from four. Something is wrong with the battery compartment. After just taking a few photos it says to put in new batteries.

Reviews.Title: Nice Little Camera For The Price...
Reviews.Author: S. Zerbst
Reviews.Content: Just received my Canon Powershot A495 a few days ago. This little camera is perfect for the digital beginner picture-taker as myself. Nothing fancy but for $49 I couldn't go wrong. Installed an 8GB memory card & now I can take 100's of quality pictures with this thing. Already taken well over 50 in just two days & transfered to my laptop with ease. Very small & compact design makes it easy to carry in your pocket if you wish. Several different modes you can use but I keep it on auto-mode which makes it perfect for any natural shot you want to take. A heck of a deal!!

Reviews.Title: Gift for my daughter
Reviews.Author: Madeline Ann Lang
Reviews.Content: Bought for my daughter as a birthday gift. She liked it, was easy to use but was not happy that it didn't come with the rechargable battery.

Reviews.Title: Good Value for $75
Reviews.Author: Yankeehoya
Reviews.Content: As indicated in previous reviews this camera is not as slim as most of us would like.  The only other major drawback is the lack of a viewfinder.  On a sunny day the camera's monitor is impossible to read wearing sunglassess.  Even w/o sunglasses, I was really only guessing what the resulting photo would look like.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Crafty Lady "crafty lady"
Reviews.Content: For the price, and size of this camera it does a lot.  We are having so much fun with it.  Using the poster mode, and vivid color on plants, and animals, and everything else in between.  Everyone is always using it..Of course it doesn't do everything the bigger ones do, but for a point and shoot, and for the cost, it is great.

Reviews.Title: Great starter camera!
Reviews.Author: K. Kennedy
Reviews.Content: For a Canon camera that costs less than $80, you really can't go wrong with this camera.The picture quality is VERY good.The lag time between shots is poor, but shouldn't be a problem for a younger photographer, or someone who is just beginning to use digital cameras.All in all, this is a great choice if you're looking for a very basic, quality digital camera!

Reviews.Title: Great value for easy no-hassle pictures
Reviews.Author: J. Rogers
Reviews.Content: Purchased camera along with Canon SELPHY CP800 compact photo printer as a gift for a non-computer household.  The camera is easy to use, takes clear pictures with even, accurate colors and good lighting.  Zoom is easy to adjust. Uses AA batteries which take a few seconds to recharge between shots, but the simplicity of use makes this a very small complaint.  Transfer the SDHC card to the printer and presto...high quality prints in about a minute.  No computer cables, no software to load and update, no transferring pictures before printing.  Perfect for a non-technical/beginning user.  I would definitely purchase this again for the appropriate person

Reviews.Title: Good value camera
Reviews.Author: Ernest L. Harper
Reviews.Content: This is a fine little camera for the money.  I bought it as a birthday gift for my 15-year old grandson, who is a relative novice at digital photography.  The camera is very user-friendly and produces good quality photos.  It is an excelent example of "you get what you pay for," which I intend as a compliment.  If you're experienced with digital photography and are interested in more sophisticated features, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: Seems like a good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Tom C
Reviews.Content: The only negative I can offer is there is a 2-3 second lag from when the camera takes a picture until it is ready to take another photo. It is overall a very easy camera to use, it is compact, has a large LCD, and takes excellent pictures. I like the feature where you can select the size of the picture file. If you don't need a 10+ megabyte picture taken, since you are going to email it to friends, you can select taking pictures down to 0.3 megabyte which makes it just right for emailing.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Jidong Zhong "ÌìÆø²»´í"
Reviews.Content: Definitely worth the price (I got it for $97). Being plastic doesn't make it cheap. This camera takes great pictures, it is also pretty easy to use. I  can't expect more from a camera under $100.

Reviews.Title: Picture Perfect Camera
Reviews.Author: R. Tennant "Grandma B"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera and will not be devastated if I lose it because of the Great Price - Great Pictures

Reviews.Title: AMAZING PICS AND VIDEO
Reviews.Author: jaymac1500
Reviews.Content: For a relatively small and inexpensive camera I am truly impressed. The pics are AMAZING, in fact they are bordering on being better than real life. The color and definition are unbelievable. I can sum it up in one word - WOW!

Reviews.Title: A495 Canon Powershot - more for the money
Reviews.Author: Jerry
Reviews.Content: I am not a camera person, wanted something to point and shoot.Compared the canon powershot A495 with all others and prices.  Consumer reports compared the A490 with the Olympus  stlus tough 8010 at $270.00, the A 495 is the next step up. Saved me over $250.00.  Thr 495 has all the features and more that I want. It uses 2 AA batteries which I wanted.  It is a little slow for quick shots and flash ; however, it is fast enough for most uses.  The batteries lasted for 50 shots. The most imporant buying advice is to read the reviews on amazon.com.

Reviews.Title: Flimsy metal casing
Reviews.Author: bob kupor
Reviews.Content: I had this camera only one week before returning it. The designers foolishly designed it so that the required AA batteries are spring-pressed against the flimsy "door" (the one that must be opened to insert the batteries). Part of this door was visually protruding from the camera body by 1/6th inch within a week. Also, this camera is more expensive than it seems, because the AA batteries you've got to buy add up with time. Other cameras come with rechargeable specialized batteries that last years.

Reviews.Title: Great Digital - Canon 495
Reviews.Author: smit8100
Reviews.Content: Very good value. Reasonable price.  Our 1st digital camera & we wondered why we waited so long.  Extremely easy to use, even for the novice.  If & when we need to buy another, it will likely be a Canon.

Reviews.Title: cheap camera that takes nice pics of stationary objects
Reviews.Author: Y. Bronshteyn "Dr. B"
Reviews.Content: i know very little about photography, but i do know when a hard is easy to use and takes excellent pictures.pros:- inexpensive- takes excellent pictures of stationary objectscons:- flash is slow to recharge- the camera is miserably slow at focusing at in on distant objects when you use the optical zoom- if you loose patience with how long it takes the camera's auto-focus to focus in on an object or person, the pictures will invariably come out blurry- battery life is short when you use the flash regularlybottom line:- still probably worth it if you want a very basic point-and-shoot camera under $100

Reviews.Title: TERRIBLE! BATTERY LIFE IS LESS THAN 1 DAY
Reviews.Author: Todd Dolce "Greenland"
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe that Canon would even release this thing! I have tried it with several different types of batteries and not one of them will last more than 1 day. INCREDIBLE!!!!!!! The other day,..I put in fresh batteries out of the box.....took the camera to my son's game. Took 10 photos within 1 hour of putting in the batteries....DONE! batteries are drained. What a piece of junk!

Reviews.Title: Don't be fooled by Canon brand name -- very poor image quality!
Reviews.Author: Vikram Surya Chiruvolu
Reviews.Content: Only about 1 in 10 shots comes out crisp.  For a point-and-shoot, this is one of the worst products I've seen out there.  Unless you're willing to pay with lots of frustration that moments and memories you wanted have instead slipped away, choose one of the many better products available at reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: Got a deffective one...
Reviews.Author: Sima "S"
Reviews.Content: Every now and then you find reviews from people who were extremely unhappy with this little camera. Well, mine is one of those. Super light, but feels cheap. Blurry pictures - couldn't get it to focus (tried indoors, outdoors, flash/no flash, etc). Had to return. Was supposed to be a gift for my mom, got her Canon SX-120 instead - very happy.

Reviews.Title: Is this really a Canon?
Reviews.Author: Research Not Antidotes "Dee"
Reviews.Content: I did not think I could go wrong buying this product but I did. The picture quality is what a camera is all about and this camera has very poor picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Great camera and easy to use
Reviews.Author: María de los A. Díaz
Reviews.Content: I bought this type of cameras in the past year  and this is the best. Great quality of photos, easy to use. It focus and shot very fast.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Happy Parent
Reviews.Content: Got this for my son for his birthday and love the pics it takes.  I will be getting one for myself as well but in blue.

Reviews.Title: Good quality for the price
Reviews.Author: Lobo
Reviews.Content: I'm a Canon entusiast. This one is only the entry-line, but works fine and is small enough to take anywhere, not very sensible to low light tough. Common AA batteries (which I prefer): I can buy them anywhere when my rechargeables have run out.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: JWG27
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my granddaughter for Christmas and she has not put it down! It came highly rated by Consumer Reports and it has certainly lived up to the rating. It was easy to set up and it works great.

Reviews.Title: Digital camera
Reviews.Author: R. Ostermeyer
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my 9 year old grandson who didn't want a "baby" camera anymore.  It's the most inexpensive one that Canon has, but it really does take good pictures.

Reviews.Title: not a action camera
Reviews.Author: Gary L Andersen
Reviews.Content: Forget about taking any action shots with this camera. It will turn out blurry. It works ok on still shots of scenery but not on moving objects.

Reviews.Title: Regretful purchase
Reviews.Author: superawesomeguy
Reviews.Content: Pros:Was relatively cheap when I bought it (around $80)Cons:Poor photo qualityMust keep hand absolutely stillTakes legitimately four seconds to focus and a take a pictureNot nearly as sleek as it appears in stock photosBottom Line:Don't buy it.

Reviews.Title: Terrible pic quality
Reviews.Author: AmazingSupergirl "AmazingSupergirl"
Reviews.Content: This camera is ridiculously horrible.  Unfortunately we used it on a hiking trip a while back and it didn't catch the beautiful scenery at all.  Close ups and long shots were all hazy and the color wasn't true.  My friend bought this camera and gave it to me.  I feel compelled to write a review and detou people from purchasing.  I saw it sells for around 100 bucks.  I'd go for one of the ELPHS.  I only say that because I have a really old 3 pixel with just 3x zoom and it still takes much better pics than this one.  Please at least be prepared to return, if possible on this camera.  Sorry to be the bearer of negative news but I'm just sharing my experience.  Good luck with you camera shopping!

Reviews.Title: Comapct, but packs a punch !
Reviews.Author: Bernadette
Reviews.Content: So far so good.  Had it for several years now.  No complaints.  People brag about the quality of my photos!!

Reviews.Title: Great photos
Reviews.Author: Buffy Collins
Reviews.Content: Great little camera.  This is the second one that we bought.  The only flaw in the first one we bought was keeping the battery cover closed.  A piece of tape helped.

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: alicia hazlewood
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in May 2011. It's a really good camera with great video and very clean photos. Its only problem is that after a year or so the battery gate does not close on its own. I normally use a piece of clear tape to keep it shut. This however does not affect the camera's performance. when i compare it to one i previously own; this camera is by far better.

Reviews.Title: I'm surprised.
Reviews.Author: chevy77
Reviews.Content: I got this camera as an alternative to carrying my Rebel with zoom lens.  On the pro side: 1. It takes nice pictures for its size.  2. Very portable .. I can carry it in my back pocket.Cons: Can only zoom to 3.3 after that the digital zoom takes over and you get pixilated pictures.

Reviews.Title: Ugh
Reviews.Author: B. Mowry "dogsrunningamuck"
Reviews.Content: I was using this camera today, and realized that I had a few things to say about it, even though I purchased it a few years ago. The camera itself is lightweight and easy to use. The batteries are the problem. This camera drains batteries (AA's) like nobody's business. I've used it for international travel and local activities and get SO frustrated. I always have a number of back-up batteries in case the camera  tells me to "change the batteries". I put two new batteries in this morning, took about a dozen pictures, and within 4 hours it was already telling me to change the batteries. Maybe it's just my camera, but in the future I will definitely go with a rechargeable lithium battery camera. I've also found that the battery compartment door pops open frequently. I was in Greece with it a few years ago, and the door popped open, and I lost my batteries somewhere in the bottom of a boat. Other than these issues, my only other comment would be that the images seem a bit grainy. I've used cameras with lower pixels and have had better shots. Looks like this Canon is not really available like it used to be, but I felt like I needed to say something.

Reviews.Title: Great Quality Pictures, Terrible Battery Life
Reviews.Author: Atli Hafsteinsson
Reviews.Content: This is a comfortable, easy little camera that's very straightforward to use. Picture quality is very good and it's also possible to shoot some short video footage.Having said that, this is the most voracious battery-drainer I have ever owned. Just the other day, I put two fresh AA batteries in the machine. About a total use of twenty minutes later (on and off over a few days), the camera wanted me to change the batteries.So, while the picture quality is great and handling the camera is very straightforward and easy, battery life is a terrible factor working against that.

Reviews.Title: Great camera.
Reviews.Author: StevenG
Reviews.Content: Absolutely great digital camera with high quality results.Simple design, and perfect productivity for a budget camera.No problem at all, just point ant shoot and get perfect pictures and good video.

Reviews.Title: Compact and Handy
Reviews.Author: Tom Elder "Tom S."
Reviews.Content: After several sessions with the instructions and considerable trial and error I got use to basic use of this camera.  Its not exactly the old Brownie point and shoot but you can get basically good shots with  a good deal of patience.

Reviews.Title: Purchased for a specific purpose.
Reviews.Author: Summer101
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Canon A495 specifically to test CHDK scripts.  The day I found this camera online Amazon was running a special price of ~$40 for the unit.  At that price, I decided to take a chance.  I was able to load CHDK scripts to take time lapse and motion detection photography.This camera was probably of fine quality when it was first released.  However, the pictures are lackluster compared to our current availability of inexpensive high resolution cameras and there are many better options available.  I will keep this camera since it handles my desired tasks but If I weren't doing CHDK photography, I wouldn't purchase this camera again even for $40.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: BestFishOill.com
Reviews.Content: I like this camera, the only problem is sometimes it takes a while to take a picture with flash because it takes sometime after a flash for the screen to get back again to take another picture. But it is a good one for regular use.

Reviews.Title: Flash charge waaaaaaay too slow
Reviews.Author: jryan703
Reviews.Content: I only use it now for daytime.  Ten seconds for a flash to get ready is just too long for most pictures.

Reviews.Title: Quick and easy
Reviews.Author: Anna Preziosi
Reviews.Content: This is a very good quick and easy digital camera.  I have since bought a DSLR but find when I go for walks I just grab this and the photos come out great.  Fits right into a coat pocket.

Reviews.Title: Poweershot A495
Reviews.Author: jmst196100
Reviews.Content: like the camera - this was a replacement for one I had j just like it, pretty easy to operate.

Reviews.Title: I
Reviews.Author: Freddy Estrella
Reviews.Content: I love it great product A + + + + +  + + + + + + + ++ +

Reviews.Title: Slow start up and shot
Reviews.Author: D. Nguyen
Reviews.Content: Very slow, feels cheap, and the AA batteries always need to be replaced. Your better off getting rechargeable batteries if you get this camera. Only positive, has video at this price point.

Reviews.Title: Okay-ish, lower end Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: R. Price "Drako"
Reviews.Content: Pics don't appear to have the crispness one would expect from a 10mp camera.  I think it's fair to say the majority of shots from this camera have more blur than the 5.0 and 7.2 megapixel cameras we've had in the past (comparing the shots next to each other, I'm now certain of this).  Not sure what the weakness is in this camera, but I ended up giving it to my 12 year old as basically a toy since it failed to deliver on so many occasions for me.  THe only Canon camera I've ever had that disappointed.  Good enough for the kids to play with or to use as a back up...  price was about right given the limitations of the camera.

Reviews.Title: good point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Maureen
Reviews.Content: good pictures with this camera.  easy to learn menu for features to change settings, set the lighting, zoom in and out.  use the good batteries with this camera, the extra durable not the cheap store brands.

Reviews.Title: kind of a piece of junk
Reviews.Author: Markie Twain "Markie"
Reviews.Content: The problem with getting a battery powered camera is that the camera is battery powered. Which means the thing runs out of batteries if you even LOOK at it too long. Camera seems a little flimsy in the hand. Pictures are good with it, when you remember to put fresh batteries in it. This would be a good backup emergency type of camera. If you are looking for a good everyday camera, get one with a rechargable battery, much less hassle.

Reviews.Title: My daughter loves it
Reviews.Author: Denyse Roberts
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my 10 year old daughter for her birthday. She loves it and take great pictures, she snaps everything she see's. The good thing about this camera is , it takes great pictures in the day time. As long as you have light, this camera is good to go. This camera is an out door camera because you will get your most used from outside.The camera is light weight and works with 2 double A batteries. The bads things about this camera  are the following:1. It takes to long to recongnize your subject, If you snap your picture before it will come out blurry.2. It will not work with regular  double A batteries, it must be alkiline double A batteries.3. If you using the video , you cannot  use zoom features.4. You get alot of blurry pictures.I would recommend this camera for anybody who wants an inexpensive camera, just to shoot pictures in the day time.

Reviews.Title: Save your money and get a better model
Reviews.Author: Amazon Lover
Reviews.Content: This camera was a purchase for my not technically savvy mom. It feels very cheap (it's made of plastic) and the batteries do not last very long. I wish I had purchased a better model for just a few dollars more.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Compact Camera!!
Reviews.Author: mining woman "spiritual seeker"
Reviews.Content: This is a great sized camera!  It fits in my glove box, my pouch, and even in my computer bag with the computer in it!!!  I don't like the slow flash, however.  I love the color and the zoom it easy and fast!!

Reviews.Title: Not the best camera
Reviews.Author: okiedan
Reviews.Content: I have had this now for two years.  It has held up fine and renders fair quality pictures.  The main issue with this camera is the Extreme recovery time between shots.  You will miss pictures if you are trying to take any kind of action pictures.  ie.....following the grandkids around the house or on the soccer field.  The recovery time between shots is just unacceptable.  I would not buy this camera again.  Pay a little more and get an upgrade......you will be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Lucy
Reviews.Content: I have always loved my Canon's. And have owned quite a few "PowerShots" in the past. You really get what you pay for with this. My photos are always blurry. When the flash is on I constantly take photos just after the moment I am trying to capture has passed. The flash needs to charge, and takes several seconds to snap the photo. The red eye reduction does not work and all my photos come out with red eye when taken indoors. Outdoors is fine.

Reviews.Title: If it was any slower i could use a pinhole camera !!!!
Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: Not even going to bother reviewing the features on this camera because it is sooooooo unbelievably slow. The lag time between photographs is absolutely ridiculous. I went from a sony cybershot circa 2003 to finally investing in a new camera...but this thing is so useless that I actually went back to using my 2003 sony. I highly, highly recommend looking elsewhere unless you prefer taking 1 picture every 5 minutes. Useless and frustrating!!!!

Reviews.Title: Awesome little camera!
Reviews.Author: G. E. Glaum
Reviews.Content: I love this little camera! Great pictures! Easy to use! Easy to upload and download! Get a spare memory card and bring spare batteries. One trick I learned is to remove the batteries and switch them around when the indicator signals a low battery state. I get twice the life out of my batteries that way. You won't regret getting this camera unless you are looking for a professional SLR Digital or something far beyond the needs of a mere mortal who just wants to take good pics without a huge hassle.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera!
Reviews.Author: Chrissy
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a trip to disney. I did not want to carry the larger cannon rebel I have and i wanted something simple so my husband can us it too. I have to say it worked great for a point and shoot camera. Came homw with some awsome shots.

Reviews.Title: Not worth it
Reviews.Author: Engineer
Reviews.Content: Not durable.  Spend a bit more money and get a better camera.  I have higher end Canon's and I like them.  This is chincy.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: E. L. Kaw "Ed"
Reviews.Content: The reasons I bought this camera was because this was on sale and as a birthday gift for my 12 year-old son.  Image quality is ok and for a young boy who wants memories from his school days this more than serves his purpose.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: M. Mungal-mattai "steffano"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera,easy to use love the features and the picture quality is great.  I use re-chargable AA batteries and they last quite a long while.

Reviews.Title: Great starter camera
Reviews.Author: J. Paschal
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter (college age) just for fun pictures! She's a photography major, so this camera is definitely used just for fun with her friends and family. Thus far, the pictures come out quite clear and she likes he little zoom of the lens. It is a lightweight camera and I wouldn't buy this for a younger child as it could easily break if dropped. It also doesn't come with a micro SD card, so there isn't any storage of pictures without one. Overall, I'd say this is a good starter camera for most people who are not professionals or just want to take some family photos without all the fancier or hard to understand directions that other digital cameras may have. Good deal for me.

Reviews.Title: Sad to say  no good
Reviews.Author: Eric Matthews "country geek"
Reviews.Content: Bought camera for my 10yr old son for christmas.The pictures ti takes are nice and clear but it broke in less than a week.It started to show a "lens error" and then the len would not retract.My my son was a good sport about it and was just concerned he had lost the pictires he had takenand thanks to Amazon painless retuns I got him another camera.I went with the  Kodak EasyshareKodak Easyshare C1505 12 MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Zoom - Red due to its non zoom lens less moving parts to fail.

Reviews.Title: Great buy from Amazon and at such great prices.
Reviews.Author: busy mom "Michelle"
Reviews.Content: Great prices, good product! Will come back again!My items always arrive promptly and the prices are competitive. Free delivery.

Reviews.Title: Good value, but some drawbacks
Reviews.Author: SecretAsianSam
Reviews.Content: I got this as a secondary digital camera meant for more portability.  It is very light and efficient and easy to carry around.  It's got a nice look and can take photos up to 10Mpxl, as well as video.  What I don't like about it is that it takes 2 AA batteries and sucks the life out of them really fast.  Of course, you don't need to have the camera on all the time, and even if the battery is a little sapped you can still turn it off and on just to take your pictures.  But just be sure to always have some AA batteries around.  The package does not come with a USB connector cable, which means that you will need to get one or get an SD card reader to transfer images to your computer.  Not a big deal, but would have been nice.  Also, the package does not include a case.  Overall, it is a very good value, especially since I got it on an Amazon-sale for $49.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot A495 10.0 MP
Reviews.Author: Damian Marks
Reviews.Content: Good camera. I am pleased with the results except that it doesn't seem to handle motion well. Blurs with action shots.

Reviews.Title: Great Starter Camera
Reviews.Author: Muru Venkat
Reviews.Content: I got this camera in red color for Christmas last year for my daughter.  This camera has a better sensor than SD1100 and takes great pictures and it is very easy to use.  Uses 2 AA batteries and it lasts a reasonable time.  Ideal camera for children. Highly recommended! A+++++

Reviews.Title: So far, so good
Reviews.Author: PlumLover
Reviews.Content: After only 2 hours with the camera I am confident in how to use it and the photo quality is very impressive..  Well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: Truly great purchase
Reviews.Author: wantobeapet
Reviews.Content: nice camera, what else do you want for a Canon camera under $100! you won't be wrong to buy a Canon camera

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: A. Ellis "Drew"
Reviews.Content: When I needed a simple camera for work, this camera seemed like a good solution.  I have been using the camera for four months with no problems. This is a great starter or basic point-and-shoot camera.Pros:-Simple and easy to use out of the box-Uses 2 AA batteries, easily replaceable-Takes great pictures in high light-Macro function works well-The camera is small and light - fits well into pockets-Controls are easy to useCons:-Lense movement is crude and noisy compared to higher-end point-and-shoot cameras-Picture quality is noisy in low light-Viewer display resolution is acceptable but low-end

Reviews.Title: Good product for the price
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: Camera takes really good pictures for under $100.  It is a bit slow to be ready for the next picture as others have said (couple of seconds).  We have had no problem with battery life - about 500 pictures per set of batteries (most of them without flash).

Reviews.Title: decent camera
Reviews.Author: wickedlittlelight
Reviews.Content: decent camera for the price ...got it as a backup , keep it in the car just in case i see something interesting and it fulfiils this function fine..have a better camera for "important" stuff but this works great as a back up

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Dean A. Zwicker
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera to use on vacations where we did not desire to carry a heavier camera.  For the price, it has performed wonderfully.  We would recommend this camera for anyone!

Reviews.Title: bad craftsmanship
Reviews.Author: Buck1
Reviews.Content: I have had nothing but Canon Sureshot cameras for some time now, but this one was a problem and the battery/SD card door was cheaply made and was defective out of the box.

Reviews.Title: Nice pictures, hungry camera
Reviews.Author: Debbie K
Reviews.Content: This camera is very easy to set up and use, and the picture quality is very good.  The only drawback is that you'd better have plenty of battery on hand.  It seems to want a change of batteries every 20-40 shots.

Reviews.Title: good camera in his genre
Reviews.Author: Chepe
Reviews.Content: this camera is great in it genre  is located,  has a good image quality and the photographic modes are  a good automatic option for to get some artistic pictures. all this for the value that you are paying is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot A495
Reviews.Author: D. S. Semeraro
Reviews.Content: Compact, light, easy to use, attractive.  A camera for dummies! Would have preferred it came with a memory card, but easy to get. I'm enjoying it.

Reviews.Title: Perfect gift for non-techy Parents
Reviews.Author: Adi
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a very good price to send as a gift to my Aunt. Its very simple to use and picture quality is great as always with Canon.

Reviews.Title: Nice Basic camera
Reviews.Author: keytardan
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a very simple, very basic digital camera, this is a good buy.  It doesn't have any bells or whistles to it.  No video, only still picture capability.  We bought it to use to take school picutres for a slide show.  It's cheap, and easily replaced if lost or damaged.  Don't forget to buy the right memory card for it, since it doesn't have any internal memory.

Reviews.Title: Incidentally Nice
Reviews.Author: Boxcar "motala"
Reviews.Content: Purchased the A495 for incidental use but, discovered it takes very nice pictures.Having a complete manual available from the enclosed CD was very helpful.Perhhaps the only thing missing in the general instructions was how to reduce pictures in order to send via e-mail.Chose Canon because of their general excellence and was not disappointed.The only caveat, as mentioned by other reviewers, was the lack of a regular view finder, thus taking pictures in bright sunlight difficult.However, all in all, a great camera for all uses.

Reviews.Title: Canon A495
Reviews.Author: Carolyn Morgan
Reviews.Content: I bought this on the deal of the day and am happy with my purchase.  For those of us who just want an easy to use small camera without alot of bells and whistles, this is a good choice.  The pictures I have taken while on vacation may not be worthy of Nat Geo standards, but they are clear and the color is good.  Flash recovery time is a bit long, but that has not been a problem for me, and I like that it takes easy to find AA batteries.

Reviews.Title: Excellent compact camera, exceptional value!
Reviews.Author: Amazon fan
Reviews.Content: This may be an inexpensive camera (I got mine for 49 bucks) but it is not a toy or a kiddie camera. Since it is based on the Canon Digic III image processor it has many of the same features as more expensive cameras using this processor.When taking photos outdoors in good light you can just set it to auto and shoot. However, auto will not always provide the best results in all lighting situations.To take advantage of all the features this camera has to offer you owe it to yourself to learn how to use the options available in Program AE mode. Shooting is mostly automatic but you have control over settings such as ISO, metering mode, white balance, exposure compensation, etc. In less than ideal lighting conditions these options will allow you to get great results without a flash. If you're not already familiar with Canon cameras you should definitely take a look at the User Manual on the CD.For the price this camera is an amazing value. Which wouldn't matter if the photo quality wasn't there, but it is. This is another excellent Canon camera.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot A495
Reviews.Author: Kemberly S. Dibiase "ksd42499"
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera for my daughter's 7th birthday. It has worked great so far and the pictures really look good. Very easy for a younger child to use! she really loves this camera. Very good purchase.

Reviews.Title: competent
Reviews.Author: Carrie M. "bookguru"
Reviews.Content: Handy camera to have in the car or purse for the quick shot.  I bumble with the phone camera so this is easy.  Not super excellent quality and takes a few seconds to refresh the batteries when using the flash.  Perfect for the price and suffers well through the jumble of my purse.

Reviews.Title: Good results so far.
Reviews.Author: L. P.
Reviews.Content: Haven't used the camera much yet but good results so far.  I'm not an expert photographer but am pleased with how the camera works, with the software, and with the quality of the photos.

Reviews.Title: Little Gem
Reviews.Author: C. Mhughes
Reviews.Content: Great little camera. I have a higher end canon. I compared the picture quality between the two. The power shot A495 was just as good.It is easy to use as well. I will say ..yes as mentioned in some posts the top to the battery compartment is flimsy be careful when replacing batteries. As far as the battery life was not so bad. I am very happy with my purchase. For the price you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: Cannon Technology
Reviews.Author: Aigam
Reviews.Content: Practical, accurate, good design, accessible; with a large screen! and with the support of Cannon ....,  For those like me who do not know photography, travel frequently,and like to do a travel journal with photos, I think this is a very good option!

Reviews.Title: First Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: gizmoron
Reviews.Content: We are new to digital cameras and this is our first. The picture quality has been terrific and it has been easy to use. Camera to PC downloads via the USB cable and software works like a charm. So far we are quite pleased. Delivery was also prompt and free through Amazon.com. Can't beat that.

Reviews.Title: Camera review
Reviews.Author: Rod
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a gift for my girlfriend and I recieve this offer. It's a Great product for an excellent price.

Reviews.Title: Hmmmm....
Reviews.Author: Lena
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a very good price as part of a Gold Box Deal.  I knew that it was a later model, but needed a camera and didn't have much money.  Unfortunatly, I was more than a little disapointed.  It has to "charge" the flash before taking a picture in low light.  Like the disposable cameras need to.  There is no option for spontaneous photos if its not perfect light.  Also, if it is too bright outside it will automatically underexpose the shot.  That doesnt help when you are trying to get a brighter shot.  I will still use this til I can get my hands on something better, but even for the price, I was hoping for better quality from Canon.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot A495 10.0 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Stone54
Reviews.Content: It's great little camera for my kid.  He takes endless pictures and has fun with it.  We love the easy use, the speed doesn't matter because it is for my son and he can take time to take photo he likes.

Reviews.Title: Canon powerShot
Reviews.Author: Michelle A. Kinsey
Reviews.Content: I got this for a little camera for my husband to carry on his hang-glider. Well we both have had a great time just having it available for those quick shots that youdo not want to miss. This camera is Light weight and just want we wanted to carry around instead of our bigger heavier camera.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Madecontact
Reviews.Content: Nice camera.  The macro setting is excellent along with the night picture options.The auto focus and face recognition are good too.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what we were looking for!
Reviews.Author: Claire
Reviews.Content: Wanted a camera that's simple to use and has good quality pictures.  Very pleased with the ease of operating - even my husband can figure it out!  Great value for the money and we got it on sale!

Reviews.Title: inexpensive Canon
Reviews.Author: A. P. Gormley
Reviews.Content: This inexpensive Canon takes decent photos and OK YouTube-quality video.  I throw it in my briefcase for those "just in case" occasions when you need a simple camera with a flash that will take better pictures than a cellphone camera.  It was an Amazon Prime special for $49.95 plus I purchased a 8Gb Class 10 SD card for $15, another special.The shortcoming is battery life.  It uses two AA batteries, which require long flash recycle times when they get low.  I haven't tried AA Lithium batteries, but that may provide longer life and faster recycles.

Reviews.Title: great buy
Reviews.Author: jterry
Reviews.Content: Thanks to kidd kraddick I bought this and it has been great,easy to put in my purse for those candid shots.

Reviews.Title: Canon A495 by Jerry
Reviews.Author: Jerry
Reviews.Content: A very good value for the price. The only lack is image stabilization which is a problem only if you are taking pictures at slow shutter speeds without camera support.  The camera otherwise is a stellar performer, offers options that allow you to take pictures of stars up to 15 seconds.  (tripod or other support is necessary for this)  You do need to read the manual (including the one supplied on the disc) to learn how to access all these features.  Movies are 640 x 480, about ordinary TV type resolution.  Camera will make excellent close ups (use the flower setting on program mode) I have even managed to take a pretty good picture of the Moon through a telescope where almost everything visible through the telescope was visible in the picture.  I generally use the 16 x 9 setting (7.5 megapixels) for most of my photos as it fits this laptop's computer screen the best.  For a low cost camera this Canon A495 is an excellent bargain. I would strongly recommend using rechargable batteries or lithium AA's as the life of the batteries it comes with is much shorter than when using these recommended batteries.  Also flash recycling time is shorter with these.

Reviews.Title: canon powershot A495 10. MP
Reviews.Author: M. K. Ritzel "angel lady"
Reviews.Content: I get clear photos easily.  my neighbors (elderly) can also take excellent pics of me and family when I ask.  easy to change batteries and insert/remove card to upload.  strongly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Lora in Wausau
Reviews.Content: I like that it takes regular batteries and is easy to view the pictures on a nice sized screen.  Good camera for a reasonable price.  Do not like the delay when taking pictures.

Reviews.Title: new Canon camra
Reviews.Author: Karen
Reviews.Content: This camera Canon Powershot A1200 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Zoom (Black) was purchased as a back up camera based upon Canon reputation and previous experience with this product family. The non-chargeable batteries (AA) provides the option of immediate shooting opportunities by insertion of a new pair of batteries.

Reviews.Title: New Camera!
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: I purchased this in a package for a really nice price.  This camera was purchased for our family trip.  I wish the camera was better at taking action shots.

Reviews.Title: A nice spare
Reviews.Author: V. Ruan "Aaron"
Reviews.Content: In modern world I believe everyone should have a camera in their car's grove box ready to serve the purposes of car accident, snap shot, candid shot, and many other unexpected occasions. This camera is made out of plastic, and appears not a very high quality one, but it serves my purpose.

Reviews.Title: Canon POWERSHOT
Reviews.Author: Errol Walter
Reviews.Content: I give this camera a five stars because of ease of use and the price was very good for the money it costs. The only complaint I have is that it did not come with a picture card.

Reviews.Title: Powershot
Reviews.Author: B. Dean "speedz69"
Reviews.Content: This is a good value camera.Not the best camera but it may be the best value camera.It is lite and very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: nice little camera
Reviews.Author: Daniel Lee Schmidt
Reviews.Content: this is a nice little camera, my only problem with it is that the memory card in in the battery compartment. You have to open the battery compartment take the card out and put in in my card reader, the hinge on the battery compartment is a little flimsy, so I can only assume that this will be the first thing that will break. I know I can use the other cord to download the pictures but that means adding another program to my computer and I just did not want to do that.

Reviews.Title: Nice For Kids
Reviews.Author: Lydia Rising
Reviews.Content: This was a purchase for my 8 year old granddaughter. The camera has been great for her. It takes nice quality photos, appears to be sturdy, and is just right for a budding photographer!

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot A495
Reviews.Author: David Dobbs
Reviews.Content: My mom and dad got this for me when I told them I really really wanted a camera and begged for one. I was very happy when it came and immediately picked it up and started taking random snaps of stuff. It took me a moment to figure out how to shoot video, but I was very pleased with the video (and picture) quality and the resolution of the screen. I've had it since April 2011 and it's still going strong. Very good battery life and a nice amount of modes. A nice little camera for a kid who wants a non-confusing camera that he/she can take easy pics with. All in all a great little camera. P.S. I am 9 yrs old and used my dad's account to write this review.Edit Spring 2012: The camera is still living up to my expectations, especially since I started borrowing my dad's Gorillapod to shoot videos. I forgot to mention that the controls are very easy to use and just the right size. It is also very easy to look at pictures and adjust the zoom. This camera is very pretty too!P.S. The "newer model" is a completely different Canon camera.Update Jan 5, 2013. I am having a problems with it now.  Problem 1: The battery/SD card compartment no longer shuts right. I have had to tape it shut with electrical tape, which leaves black residue on the front of the camera. I think this was due to a 2-ft drop onto a hard (although carpeted) floor. Problem 2: Lens sometimes makes a funny sound when opening, zooming, and closing. Only a noise, though, nothing physical. Problem 3: This little guy is suddenly devouring batteries. I have to carry 2 or 3 pairs of AAs with me whenever I use the camera.And for those who want some tech specs: 640p video, 10MP photos. It can take almost 3000 photos with an empty 8GB SDHC card. From power-on to photos: 2-3 seconds. Zoom 3.3x optical, 13x digital. The digital zoom makes everything really grainy, though.

Reviews.Title: canon powershot camera
Reviews.Author: Donna Kelly
Reviews.Content: This is a very cool camera, my first one I've ordered. and it's easy to use. The size and price are great.

Reviews.Title: bad quality, it is broken about 1year
Reviews.Author: mark
Reviews.Content: broken after one year. I only used it a few times.The picture quality is horrible. bad experience.I will not buy any cheap stuff again.Pay what you get

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Shug86
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my mothers birthday gift and she loved it. This is her first digital camera. I just got tired of her pulling out a disposable camera at every event. Now she has a classy camera that is easy to use and takes nice clear pictures. So far so good.

Reviews.Title: lot of camera for the money.
Reviews.Author: Swamp Wizard
Reviews.Content: If you want a convenient camera and are a general user, this would be a good camera for you.It takes a great picture without requiring you to do anything but turn it on and snap the picture.
