The pictures are easy to retrieve from the camera and I have not found the battery consumption to be a problem. It helps conserve the batteries if it is not left on continuosly. I turn it off if I am not planning on taking a picture for a few minutes.It is small and I like the blue color.  It is designed well ergonomically.

Reviews.Title: Great Gift
Reviews.Author: Gene Thomas "p jocky"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera as a gift and it proved to be a great buy. They love it and can't stop thanking me for giving it to them.

Reviews.Title: Canon A495
Reviews.Author: Don
Reviews.Content: Nice, very reasonably priced.  Bought it because of a high rating by Consumers Report magazine.  However, bring along a lot of AA batteries as it runs low on it's 2 batteries very quickly.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE this camer
Reviews.Author: Alice Safford
Reviews.Content: Got this as a gift and I absolutely love it. The red one is just gorgeous!Other than looks, it's just a simple P&S; that takes high quality pictures. I'm not into too many functions and don't really know how to use them, so I can't really comments on it. For a dumb user like me, I think this camera works.

Reviews.Title: For our needs, this camera is perfect.
Reviews.Author: Edward Scott "ewscott"
Reviews.Content: I needed an easy, fast responding point and shoot camera for my girlfriend.  This one fit the bill perfectly.  Easy to store away, easy and fast to turn on, slow to drain the batteries, batteries easy to find anywhere... 4gb card holds more pics than she can ever shoot.  For some people the fewer buttons and switches the better, so this camera ... one that is easy to use and still takes gorgeous pics... is perfect... top marks from me.  The video this cam makes is not any better than your phone cam, so if that's what you're after, look elsewhere, but for snapshots and nice portraits, this cam does the job.Update after 7 months use:  Still taking great pics, but this cam was borrowed by my (now) wife's friend and apparently dropped, causing the lens mechanism to jam.  I looked all over the web for some way to repair it, and found that only sending it back to the mfr gets satisfaction.  Well I monkeyed with it until I found how to fix it, so if you have this problem let me know and I'll help you!  Wife cried when her friend broke it, but cheered when it was repaired... still working fine.

Reviews.Title: Convenient backup
Reviews.Author: Duncan Macswain
Reviews.Content: I purchased this to give to families and local  friends during the Yap Day festivals in micronesia. I needed something that was easy to use, required minimal instructions and gave reliable results. Something that would be fun for non-photographers. It was perfect for what I was looking for. A friend fell in love with it and I gave the A495 away at the end of my stay, and now I plan to buy another before leaving on a trip to South America.

Reviews.Title: shutterbug
Reviews.Author: JUST ME
Reviews.Content: We bought this for our 11 yr old granddaughter's 11th birthday because she wanted a blue camera. She loves it and it's a great starter camera.

Reviews.Title: Vivid Setting Rocks!
Reviews.Author: F. Wise "JV"
Reviews.Content: Just bought this to replace an A480 that's suffering the dreaded "lens error" after 2 years of frequent use. Buying another one at only $79 makes a lot more sense than fixing the old one and the new one has easier to see controls on the back. Other than that, I think this unit is virtually identical to it's elder which cost about $110 in its day. I just tried the "Vivid" setting and it makes the pictures really pop with color (it only took me 2 years to discover it has this setting - I'll check the older one to see if it has it also).I use this camera primarily for a weekend mobile DJ service I run. I take about 100 pictures per event and display them on a big screen of the party goers. I even sell the pictures some times, so yes this does professional quality work. My only complaint is that it takes about 8 seconds for the flash to recharge (FYI - I use rechargable batteries that give me up to 200 flash shots). I love that it uses AA batteries because you never have to worry about lugging around a specialized charger (I just carry a spare pair of ready to go rechargables and a pair of "real" batteries for emergencies but I've never needed to open the emergency pack). Real handy, real small, and great pictures.I recently bought a much more expensive and fancier Canon D60 DSLR with an upgraded telephoto lens that cost me about $2000. This camera takes just about as good of pictures as the pro model (when shooting wide angle)and is much easier to carry around. I know some people say this is a cheap camera but if this thing were available a decade ago, you could have charged $1000 for it and people would have stood in line to buy it. Now they just need to add HD video to this model and it will be perfect.

Reviews.Title: ABSOLUTE CRAP!!  BATTERY LIFE IS LESS THAN 1 DAY
Reviews.Author: JC
Reviews.Content: This is the worst product I have ever had in my entire life.  I put in new batteries, take two pictures, turn it off, then the batteries are drained the next morning.  UNBELIEVABLE PIECE OF TOTAL CRAP!  CANON SHOULD BE SUED.

Reviews.Title: cheap camera
Reviews.Author: shutterbug
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my son 2 months ago. He enjoyed the camera until it stopped working recently. The on switch no longer functions. I'm sending the camera back to Canon for repairs. In the meantime, he has no camera to use during the summer. I own more expensive canon cameras that work well. My advice is to buy a different brand in this price range.

Reviews.Title: Worst Camera I've ever had
Reviews.Author: Mellojean "Mel"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera on sale for around $60 and it was a total  waste. The camera is SOOOOOOOO slow. You literally have to wait 3 seconds between each shot. The quality is lousy. Unless you hold it perfectly still, the photos can be blurry. Don't try to take photos of things that are moving or things in low light. The only photos that turn out okay are stagnant with plenty of light. I expected so much more from a Canon. I have a Rebel which I love. I bought this one because it had better megapixels than other small cameras I have and because it fits so well in my purse. This is best suited for a child, but too expensive to give to one.

Reviews.Title: Excelente funcional buena calidad y Barato!!!
Reviews.Author: Santiago
Reviews.Content: Excelente camara para el precio que compre US$50 es excelente para tenerlo en el vehiculo para cualquier ocasión. Las fotos super claras excelente camara.

Reviews.Title: Ok for the Price - TAKES AA BATTERIES
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: For the price, as I purchased it with a discount ($49.00, it was a decent deal.The camera feels cheap, but it is what I expected for the price.The main issue is that it takes AA batteries, not a rechargeable Li Ion as I expected.  May be my fault for not reading the product description closely enough.Also, when taking a picture with a flash, there is a delay as it recharges the flash.  This can cause you to miss the picture you were wanting.Overall, I suggest spending a little more money and getting a better cameral

Reviews.Title: An old model
Reviews.Author: souldivider
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my nephew when it was on the daily deal. I wish I had read the technical details and size info. It is not a thin one like the new models. It uses two AAA batteries not a battery pack. Resolution of screen is bad. Shooting modes are all in the menu, no physical buttons or knobs for easy access to the modes. Lens zooms in and out slowly with a weird sound and not smoothly.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price, I guess.
Reviews.Author: Ally
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace the Canon Powershot SD630 that I lost. I got it during the "deal of the day" special for only $49 (a price I couldn't resist). Unfortunately, it was a MAJOR downgrade from the higher end Canon powershot cameras. Like many of the reviews mentioned, it is very, very slow. After taking a picture, the screen would remain black for a few seconds while saving the picture to the SD card. During picture taking, it kept auto focusing without me pressing anything, which was incredibly annoying. The picture quality was nice though, as expected from a Canon. After taking only two pictures with it, I sold the camera.I would recommend this camera as a starter camera. For those who like to take a lot of pictures, invest a little more money in a nicer camera.

Reviews.Title: A Great Camera for dummy's....
Reviews.Author: Sunny65
Reviews.Content: I was looking for something that would be easy to use and that I could take pictures and down load on to the computer or get copies made at the store....well this is it and great pictures...

Reviews.Title: Love It
Reviews.Author: Melissa Riddle
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to have a smaller one I could carry around in my purse that didnt weight too much and I am very very pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera!
Reviews.Author: Ellie
Reviews.Content: When I needed a new camera, I chose this one. It was similar to my old one and the price was right. It's smaller and fits in my pocket or purse.

Reviews.Title: Takes ok shots with enough light
Reviews.Author: JG "FuzyBaffy"
Reviews.Content: I love cannon products but wasn't too impressed with this camera.  The pictures look good with a good lighting but can be noisy if there isn't enough light.  Takes awhile to charge flash.  Pictures can be quite blurry as it lacks Image Stabilization.  Getting a non blurry shot is hit or miss.

Reviews.Title: Canon powershot A495
Reviews.Author: oddone
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera for our granddaugter to take on her trip to Colorado.  Canon cameras take very good pictures.  This camera is small and compact and very easy to use.  You can navigate through the menu easily.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Robyne L. Johnson
Reviews.Content: This camera was a gift for a fourteen year old girl.She loves it! I have seen some of the pictures and they are great! The quality of the color and definition is fantastic! She has no problem using this camera,it is very easy to use.If a fourteen year old can use it,anyone can.I recommend this camera to anyone who wants easy use and quality pictures.

Reviews.Title: Clear and Colorful Pictures - Great Value
Reviews.Author: Bryan
Reviews.Content: This camera produces very good pictures compared to cameras at and slightly below this price range. Some cameras in this range produce pictures that are "washed out" and "noisy" (mainly any brand that is not from a larger company). The camera's performance is a little slow to focus and charge the flash, just make sure to pre-focus before taking the shot.I purchased this camera as a "carry camera". I have higher end P&S; and DSLR cameras which I am scared to take with me sometimes, for fear of damage, so I take this one. It does well for this and the AA batteries are nice because I can replace them anytime.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Marc McClenahan
Reviews.Content: This is my third Canon point-and-shoot, and I'm a devoted Canon customer.  Picture quality is outstanding, and the camera is easy to use for the non-professional photographer.  The Amazon.com shipping was quick and efficient as well.  Highly recommend this and other Canon cameras!

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerNOT
Reviews.Author: AJ Wolf
Reviews.Content: The Canon PowerShot A495 is deceptively photogenic. It looks sturdy and sleek in all those photos, doesn't it? I predict that the casing will last...at the most, nine months - if I am very careful.It is made with some sort of flimsy, pitiful rejected plastic.That doesn't necessarily make it a bad camera. I haven't had it long enough to find out. There is a photographer who makes cameras out of toilet paper rolls and other trash, and he is famous. So, it isn't all about the outside.However, if you are saving up, and want a reliable, sturdy, not-made-from-garbage camera - I would look elsewhere.Might I suggest - My parents have had a Canon PowerShot A590 IS for some years now, and it is quite sturdy, takes very nice photos, and has served them well. (Ironically we always seem to buy the same brand camera, but different models, and theirs are always top notch, while mine fall apart in my hands.)The A590 is bulkier and heavier, but much more reliable.

Reviews.Title: ok
Reviews.Author: S. Bouchie
Reviews.Content: I returned this camera because it took forever for it to recover after taking a picture and a lot of the pictures ended up being very blurry.

Reviews.Title: product of 90ies, takes regular AA batteries
Reviews.Author: janosik
Reviews.Content: Outdated poduct, hard to setup(!).  One battery set last for one trip.  The picture quality is inferior.  I cannot return this product because there is 3rd party behind it at amazon. com, I'll be careful next time.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Linda Iovinelli
Reviews.Content: Nice looking camera, nice price, but only worked one day.  The second day it said lens error and in troubleshotting was not able to get the lens to open or camera to stay on.  Very disappointed will be returning to Amazon.

Reviews.Title: very good!!!!
Reviews.Author: Gustavo Quevedo
Reviews.Content: amo las camaras digitales canon, me dan kas mejores fotos, las camaras canon de 10 mp solo se comparan en la calidad de la imagen a camaras de otras marcas de 12 mp y mas, la mejor eleccion al momento de adquirir una camara con la mejor imagen en sus fotos.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera - External Flash unit plug
Reviews.Author: VideoPVR "BJM"
Reviews.Content: Like my previous Canon Powershot, the quality is great so far. My only concern is how long will the flash unit work; that's what happened to my previous Powershot. I wish that Canon would put in an external flash plug; there are external flash units available for the Powershot, however, there is no flash sync plug to trigger the external flash. Other than that, my older Powershot (8Mp) is still fine without a flash. I think we're stuck with a short life for flash units; the high capacity capacitors can't last much more than a couple of years.At this price it's cheaper than getting an external flash and it's smaller. But I would have liked the extra power of an external flash to allow greater distance for low light photography.

Reviews.Title: canon budget camera
Reviews.Author: Fran
Reviews.Content: The canon purchased was okay for the money.  Disappointed it didn't have a flexiable zoom.  Can't expect much for theprice but if it was suppose to be a hundred + dollar camera I wouldn't consider it.  Okay for $49.00

Reviews.Title: Not bad for the price
Reviews.Author: Ruth Heaton
Reviews.Content: I have always loved Canon Powershot cameras.  The picture quality is good, but the wait time to see the picture is a little long.  I used a similar camera (Canon Powershot A490)when I went to China last Winter.  The only difference is the color of the camera.  I'm not sure if it was because it was so cold, but I was only able to get about 10 pictures when I was on the Great Wall.  The low battery light kept flashing, even though I put in new batteries.  I'm not entirely convinced the batteries were bad, so something with the weather maybe affected the camera.  Either way, I really wished I was able to take more pics.  I still like the camera for everyday use. I used the aforementioned camera when I went to the Galapagos in the summer and I LOVE those pictures.  The color quality is exactly what I expect from Canon, and I had no problems with the camera.  I changed the batteries almost daily, but I did take a lot of pictures.  I've used this camera (A495)with a 1gb memory card and it seems to work faster than the other camera with a 4gb card.  It seems to matter and make a difference.

Reviews.Title: Buen producto a excelente precio
Reviews.Author: Angel
Reviews.Content: Para ser una cámara de bajo costo tiene buen desempeño, aunque la calidad de las fotos son un poco baja cuando son tomadas en la noche, vale lo que cuesta realmente.

Reviews.Title: Great, inexpensive camera
Reviews.Author: Bambina Piccolina "BP"
Reviews.Content: For the price ($70 as of this post), I really don't see how you can beat this camera. The picture quality is excellent, which for me more than compensates for the delay between pictures as you take them. Honestly, who would want to snap their pictures super fast, but not have any of them turn out nice?CNET has an excellent editor's review of this particular camera, too, which weighed heavily in my initial decision to purchase it.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot A495
Reviews.Author: Sharon B. Danziger
Reviews.Content: The technically challenged should be aware.  This camera came with no memory card.  It took me a week of reading instructions to realize I had to buy the memory card separately.  The terrific price I got became not so terrific. Then I was offered an online warranty protection to buy.  Why was there no warranty as part of it.  The pictures are wonderful.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for on the go
Reviews.Author: gerianna "geri"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera to take camping, boating, fishing etc.. easy point and shot style. LOVE IT! great for the money!

Reviews.Title: Great but big camera
Reviews.Author: Alessa
Reviews.Content: I love the camera! It's easy to use, and takes great pictures. It is a little big so it was hard to find a case for it. But I deffinitely recommed this camera unless you like charging a camera rather then batteries.

Reviews.Title: warv
Reviews.Author: William Rojas
Reviews.Content: Con La Compra satisfecho ... muy bueno la Compra y la entrega!Lo recomiendo a Todos los Compradores es Fácil y confiable párrafo adquirir los Productos. saludos al Mundo!

Reviews.Title: good price, not so good camera
Reviews.Author: Debra Bennett
Reviews.Content: I have had previous Canon Power Shot cameras and loved them.  I am returning this one, though, because of the extreme delay time in viewing the picture taken and then the delay in being able to take a subsequent picture.  I want to take a picture and then be able to take a second and third without any waiting time.  This camera was way too slow and inadequate in its usage.

Reviews.Title: bad quality
Reviews.Author: G. Bernard "cafemania"
Reviews.Content: The bulky design of the camera is not an issue for me but the picture quality is not good and not sharp. Worst of al, this camera uses lithium batteries instead of those like in your cell phone. This means we have to buy new batteries very often. Even we buy rechargeable ones, they are costly and have to be changed constantly. In the long run, it will cost more than a upper grade camera. My lesson is, buy a decent camera and have a peace of mind.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for... so consider a different camera.
Reviews.Author: Jon Gerow
Reviews.Content: So a friend of mine suggested this camera, and it was on sale at Amazon really cheap, so I bit.  The first "oh shoot" moment was that the camera uses standard AA batteries instead of a rechargeable Ni-Cad or Li-Ion.  Well, at least it came with two batteries to get me started.  I then fired up the camera and found... it... was... very... sloooooooow.  From the "charging the flash" to the time it takes for the camera to auto-focus.  Using this camera is like using a camera in slow motion.  Got an action shot you don't want to miss?  Forget it... you'll miss it.  It is nice that it supports SDHC memory cards.  But I must admit that you get better pictures, faster, with the camera on a decent cell phone.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, good price
Reviews.Author: Helena
Reviews.Content: I bought the Canon PowerShot A495 10.0 MP Digital Camera with 3.3x Optical Zoom and 2.5-Inch LCD as a gift to my mother last year.  She loves it. Easy to use, takes great pictures, reasonable price and is reliable.  Last month she thought she had lost it and was  very upset.  So I looked for a better one that might have come up on the market since last year.  After looking and looking we decided the best think would be just get the same one.  We ordered it and she ended up finding the old one.  She was so excited she jumped and screamed like a kid.  We returned the new ordered one and Amazon was very good at refunding, as always.Helena Bushroe

Reviews.Title: No rechargable battery
Reviews.Author: Ahana Richards "Ahana"
Reviews.Content: I think the camera is awesome, however, was sad to see that you need to use AA batteries often in order to use the camera.  I feel it should have been clearer on the product's information.  But, the pictures that come out look quite lovely.
